result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anterian Alexander Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anterian Alexander Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Anterian Alexander Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are pursuing a DPA resolution, defense is working on scheduling a TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anterian Alexander Williams in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court this case may resolve through a deferred prosecution agreement, and requests an adjournment.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anterian Alexander Williams in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05-27-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Anterian Alexander Williams in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/25/2022@1:30p
